headline.main: INDEPENDENCE DAY,; ACCIDENTS AND INCIDENTS. Fires and Arrests of the Day. Military Parades, Fireworks, Excursions. The Celebration in the City and Elsewhere. Grations of Caleb Cushing, Henry Ward Beecher, and Rufus Choate.

docs.abstract: Fourth of July oration at Tammany
docs.lead_paragraph: The 4th of July, which came this year on Sunday, was celebrated on Monday in the usual style, and with no less enthusiasm than is usual. The day was fine, not too hot, considering the month, and the evening was cool, delicious and colorless, giving excellent opportunity for the display and appreciation of the fireworks.

docs.snippet: The steamship City of Washington, Capt. PETAIE, which sailed from Liverpool on the 23d June, arrived at this port yesterday morning. A telegraphic abstract of her news has already been given. We append additional particulars.

headline.main: YELLOW FEVER AT QUARANTINE.; Moriality at Sen--Vessels arriving short of hands, and in Distress.

docs.lead_paragraph: The arrival within a few days past of several vessels from Cuban ports, with their whole crews sick with yellow fever, and of others which have lost a large portion of their number by this disease at sea, has awakened considerable anxiety in the public mind, and has furnished the health officer with fresh arguments for the rigid enforcement of the Quarantine regulations for protecting the health of the port.

docs.snippet: The Board of Supervisors met on Monday, for the purpose of considering the assessments, and again yesterday afternoon, with Supervisor PURDY in the Chair. The following was submitted, and after the transaction of some other business, the Board...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Supervisors met on Monday, for the purpose of considering the assessments, and again yesterday afternoon, with Supervisor PURDY in the Chair. The following was submitted, and after the transaction of some other business, the Board adjourned.

docs.snippet: The world has seen instances of learned blacksmiths and poetic shoemakers; men bred as lawyers have before now set a parish on fire by their vivid preaching, and painters have mortified the whole order of inventers by their startling inventions....
docs.lead_paragraph: The world has seen instances of learned blacksmiths and poetic shoemakers; men bred as lawyers have before now set a parish on fire by their vivid preaching, and painters have mortified the whole order of inventers by their startling inventions. Still it remains generally true that a man performs the duties of a profession best who has been bred to them.

docs.snippet: The weather at Newfoundland was very stormy all day yesterday, and unfavorable for the success of the Atlantic Telegraph enterprise, though at the date of our last dispatch from Trinity Bay-7 o'clock P. M.--the skies were brightening, and clear...
docs.lead_paragraph: The weather at Newfoundland was very stormy all day yesterday, and unfavorable for the success of the Atlantic Telegraph enterprise, though at the date of our last dispatch from Trinity Bay-7 o'clock P. M.--the skies were brightening, and clear weather was promised. Nothing had been heard of the Telegraph fleet.

The day was fine, not too hot, considering the month, and the evening was cool, delicious and cloudless, giving excellent opportunity for the display and appreciation of the fireworks.

headline.main: NEW-JERSEY.; Closing of the New-Jersey State Normal School. Jersey City Items.

docs.lead_paragraph: The State Normal School, at Trenton, under the Principalship of Prof. WILLIAM F. PHELPS, closed its sessions for the Spring Term of 1858, on the lst of July, for a vacation of eight weeks. This institution wes established by an act of the Legislature in 1855.

headline.main: LATER FROM EUROPE.; CASE OF THE THOMAS WATSON. Proceeding in Parliament-The Paper Excise-Publio Education-Parliamentary Corruption. Arrival of the City of Washington.

headline.main: FRIGHTFUL MORTALITY AT SEA.; Nearly a Whole Ship's Crew Swept off by Yellow Fever-Heroic Conduct of the Captain's Wife.

docs.lead_paragraph: The British ship Grotta, Capt. NICHOLS, which sailed from Sagua La Grande on the 25th of June, with a cargo of Sugar, bound to Liverpool, was yesterday towed into Quarantine by the steamtug Huntress, Capt. BAGGS, who fell in with the ship ten miles East of Fire Island early yesterday morning.
